body: I should add that later on in the evening, OpenRA under Linux did not crash anymore on the server browser screen. Could it be that one or more of the servers that were in the list at the of the crash were using a map or other settings that OpenRA couldn't cope with?

This crash is deep inside the mono standard library / libgdiplus.  It's possible that it could be triggered by some malformed map preview -- possibly encoded in a pixel format that is supported under windows but not by that version of libgdiplus.  Without a reliable reproduction case it will be difficult to identify and fix the issue, and there's a strong chance that this is a bug in mono / libgdiplus that is completely unrelated to OpenRA.

The best I can suggest for now is to update to the latest version of mono (the current stable version is 4.8).

@pchote no problem, I think you're probably right.

I'm happy for you to close the issue if you wish.
This may still be a real bug on our side, so I think it's fair to keep it open for now.  If someone stumbles over this in 6 months time without any new reports then we can close it then.

This is just a quick guess as at least my openSUSE system has libpng warnings about known wrong color profiles in some of the PNGs we ship and I saw Fedora packagers do this:

```bash
find . -type f -name "*.png" -exec convert {} -strip {} \;
```

If you execute this command on the OpenRA main folder, does the issue go away? You will need to have ImageMagick installed.

Hi @Mailaender . At the moment myself and @dajamu cannot recreate the issue. We've played RA for several months and this was the first time we have ever hit a crash like this. As commented above, we suspect it was a map or graph perhaps being used by one of the servers in the server list.
Okay, closing for now until we have further information or when it really becomes a bigger problem. Thanks for reporting.

Did you try what @Mailaender suggested in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/12830#issuecomment-282407683?

I did execute it in the .openra profile folder but it didn't help.
This only happens if I enter the multiplayer mode where one can see the server browser.
If i enter to single player mode it doesn't happen.

Theres not much we can do to help with mono distro package issues, so I recommend waiting until after this weekend (when we are planning a bugfix release that fixes compatibility with mono 5.0), and then installing the latest version of mono following http://www.mono-project.com/download/#download-lin-ubuntu.

Unfortunately with mono 5.0 it didn't help either:

I even tried with a fresh profile.
Do you have any custom maps installed?  Try moving or deleting anything inside `~/.openra/maps`.

I tried with a completely new profile but no luck.

I am going to try a complete reinstall including mono dependencies

At this point I would bet that this is being caused by a remote map preview that is automatically fetched from the resource center when you open the MP server list.  That makes this quite a serious exploit (even if unintentional), so reopening and adding to the milestone.
The fix should be simple: [MapCache.cs#L204](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Game/Map/MapCache.cs#L204) needs a try/catch inside the RunAfterTick.
